    • Method Detail

      • getVfsPathFlat

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getVfsPathFlat(IData[] vfsList,
                                                              java.lang.String vfsParentPath)
        Take the output of the IS service wm.mft.assets.vfs:list, which is recursive for the child elements, and produce a flat list out of it. The hierarchy will be represented by constructing a path whose elements are separated by "/". This format is suitable for further consumption by standard ActiveTransfer services, particularly wm.mft.assets.vfs:view
        Parameters:
        vfsList - Unchanged output from IS service wm.mft.assets.vfs:list
        vfsParentPath - Treat vfsList input as child element of this path; not to be used directly (i.e. set to NULL), only for recursion
        Returns:
        flat list of VFS names with their full path

      • getVfsParentName

        public static java.lang.String getVfsParentName(java.lang.String vfsPath)
        Return name of parent VFS folder
        Parameters:
        vfsPath - VFS path for which to get parent name
        Returns:
        name of parent; is NULL if parent is root folder

      • getVfsName

        public static java.lang.String getVfsName(java.lang.String vfsPath)
        Return name of child VFS folder
        Parameters:
        vfsPath - VFS path for which to get child name
        Returns:
        name of child; same as VFS path if no parent exists

      • getVfsParentId

        public static java.lang.String getVfsParentId(java.lang.String vfsPath)
        Return ID of parent VFS folder
        Parameters:
        vfsPath - VFS folder for which to get parent name
        Returns:
        ID of parent; is NULL if parent is root folder
